resources.string:
GENERAL 
Awesome Pic Puzzle is a puzzle game. At the beginning of the game you choose a picture from your phone. Then the game divides up the picture into tiles. The game also removes one of the tiles from the screen so that there is a blank spot in the puzzle. You can then move around the tiles as you wish, swapping tiles for the blank tile. Real game play starts when you choose the =Scramble= option, which scrambles the tiles so that you can try to re-assemble the original picture. Tapping a tile with your finger tells the game that that is the tile that you want to move. The rules for which tiles you can move and where you can move them are slightly different in =Classic= and =Easy= mode. See below.


CLASSIC GAME PLAY 
In =Classic= mode the game is much like one that you played as a child. Each tile can only be moved into a blank tile space only if the space is immediately adjacent to the one you want to move. Classic mode is deceptively simple and reassembling a picture can be challenging.


EASY GAME PLAY 
In =Easy= mode the game is slightly modified from classic mode. The rules for moving a piece are that each tile can be moved to the location of the blank tile simply by touching it. It does not matter where the blank tile is in relation to the tile you want to move. Simply touch the tile you want to move and it will be swapped with the blank tile.


SCRAMBLE 
When you click =Scramble= the tiles in the picture are scrambled in a random way. The tile that is missing, essential to the game, is not scrambled. It comes from the same spot in the original picture from before the puzzle was scrambled. If you try to solve the puzzle using =Easy= mode and then you switch to =Classic= mode you may find the puzzle unsolvable. If this happens, switch back to =Easy= mode to finish the puzzle.


SAVE PICTURE 
The game can be configured to save the picture that you are using for your puzzle or to choose a new picture every time you play. If you choose to save the picture the entire state of game progress will be saved every time you exit the game normally. If you decide to choose a new picture with every restart, the program prompts you to find out how you want to choose the picture.


PICTURE SOURCE - GALLERY OR BUILT-IN 
When it is time to start a new game your two primary options are to choose from the gallery or to use the games built in file chooser. The built in chooser is useful if your picture is on the SD Card. The =Gallery= option uses your phones picture chooser. If you have a file manager on your phone, you will be given the option to use that when you select the =Gallery= option.


NOTE 
If the picture that you choose is too small the game will crash.
This game was created by David Liebman. It is meant to copy a plastic puzzle game he played as a child.
